column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Although parking and waiting in line for service are probably the pain in the ***. We parked in the garage behind Jinya
column3: as I remembered. I'm not pretty sure Jinya is included in this parking lot
column4: because I did not see its sign in the front of the garage. In case somebody asked you which restaurant you came here for
column5: just say you dine at Raku (like i did)
column6: then you're safe and sound. I know they do valet parking for Jinya in this same parking lot
column7: but not sure if we're allowed to park ourselves here. If you plan to come here in big group (10+)
column8: you definitely have to wait for at least 30 minutes. If you come as 2
column11: you'll get to your turn pretty quick
